content.title: Gracilis Muscle Flap
content.description: Gracilis muscle flap for groin wound coverage

key_concepts.details: Gracilis muscle on medial thigh; pedicle from profunda femoris
Medial thigh incision; identify and protect pedicle 8-10cm below pubis
Can rotate to cover groin and perineal defects
Reliable blood supply; minimal donor site morbidity

content.clinical_significance: Alternative to sartorius flap for groin coverage
content.statement: Gracilis Muscle Flap is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Procedures that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding Gracilis Muscle Flap helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of Gracilis Muscle Flap include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Gracilis Muscle Flap.
